alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Macon; Sumner; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 9:29PM CDT until March 30 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Davidson County in Middle Tennessee... Sumner County in Middle Tennessee... Northwestern Wilson County in Middle Tennessee... Northwestern Macon County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 1000 PM CDT. * At 928 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Old Hickory, or 10 miles northeast of Nashville, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Gallatin, Madison, Hendersonville, Mount Juliet, Goodlettsville, White House, Millersville, Lakewood, Westmoreland, Portland, Hermitage, Old Hickory, Mitchellville, Green Hill, Bethpage, Oak Grove, Bledsoe Creek State Park, Cottontown and Percy Priest Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 215 and 225. Interstate 65 between mile markers 88 and 101. Interstate 24 between mile markers 42 and 44. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
